Protocols/Event.html#/c:@M@BDPointSDK@ob.name: timeZoneIdentifier
Protocols/Event.html#/c:@M@BDPointSDK@ob.abstract: Local Timezone of the device when event happens

Protocols/Event.html#/c:@M@BDPointSDK@ob.name: triggerEngine

Protocols/BDPValidatable.html#/c:objc(pl.name: -valid
Protocols/BDPValidatable.html#/c:objc(pl.abstract: @returns YES if the state of this object is valid, NO otherwise.

Protocols/BDPTempoTrackingDelegate.html#.name: -tempoTrackingDidUpdate:
Protocols/BDPTempoTrackingDelegate.html#.abstract: This method indicates that Tempo Tracking has been updated

Protocols/BDPTempoTrackingDelegate.html#.name: -didStopTrackingWithError:
Protocols/BDPTempoTrackingDelegate.html#.abstract: This method is called if Tempo Tracking is stopped due to an error (for e.g. invalid destination Id)

Protocols/BDPSpatialObjectInfo.html#/c:o.name: name
Protocols/BDPSpatialObjectInfo.html#/c:o.abstract: The name of this object that was entered into Canvas

Protocols/BDPSpatialObjectInfo.html#/c:o.name: description
Protocols/BDPSpatialObjectInfo.html#/c:o.abstract: The description of this object that was entered into Canvas

Protocols/BDPSpatialObjectInfo.html#/c:o.name: ID
Protocols/BDPSpatialObjectInfo.html#/c:o.abstract: The description of this ID of the object

Protocols/BDPSpatialObjectInfo.html#/c:o.name: geometry
Protocols/BDPSpatialObjectInfo.html#/c:o.abstract: The geometry of this object that was defined in Canvas

Protocols/BDPGeometry.html#/c:objc(pl)BD.name: -intersects:
Protocols/BDPGeometry.html#/c:objc(pl)BD.abstract: Sometimes referred to as ‘hit test’ or ‘Point in polygon test’,

Protocols/BDPGeometry.html#/c:objc(pl)BD.name: -isEnclosedBy:
Protocols/BDPGeometry.html#/c:objc(pl)BD.abstract: Currently, only Circles may receive this message; other shapes will throw an assertion error in DEBUG or return NO in RELEASE.

Protocols/BDPGeometry.html#/c:objc(pl)BD.name: -boundingBox
Protocols/BDPGeometry.html#/c:objc(pl)BD.abstract: Calculates the minimum “BDBoundingBox” “bounding-box” that encloses this geometry.

Protocols/BDPGeometry.html#/c:objc(pl)BD.name: -centroid
Protocols/BDPGeometry.html#/c:objc(pl)BD.abstract: @returns The centre of a geometrical shape.

Protocols/BDPGeometry.html#/c:objc(pl)BD.name: -distanceTo:
Protocols/BDPGeometry.html#/c:objc(pl)BD.abstract: @returns the distance to another geometric shape.

Protocols/BDPGeometry.html#/c:objc(pl)BD.name: -geometryType
Protocols/BDPGeometry.html#/c:objc(pl)BD.abstract: @returns The type of current geometry. Available values: point, circle, lineString, boundingBox, polygon.

Protocols/BDPGeoTriggeringEventDelegate..name: -didUpdateZoneInfo
Protocols/BDPGeoTriggeringEventDelegate..abstract: Called whenever new BDZoneInfo “zone info” is received from Canvas.

Protocols/BDPGeoTriggeringEventDelegate..name: -didEnterZone:
Protocols/BDPGeoTriggeringEventDelegate..abstract: Implement this method to provide your own implementation when device enters a Zone.

Protocols/BDPGeoTriggeringEventDelegate..name: -didExitZone:
Protocols/BDPGeoTriggeringEventDelegate..abstract: Implement this method to provide your own implementation when device exits a Zone.

Protocols/BDPBluedotServiceDelegate.html.name: -locationAuthorizationDidChangeFromPreviousStatus:toNewStatus:
Protocols/BDPBluedotServiceDelegate.html.abstract: This method can be implemented to keep track of changes in Location Manager’s CLAuthorizationStatus.

Protocols/BDPBluedotServiceDelegate.html.name: -lowPowerModeDidChange:
Protocols/BDPBluedotServiceDelegate.html.abstract: This method can be implemented to monitor whether the iOS ‘Low Power Mode’ has been enabled or disabled.

Protocols/BDPBluedotServiceDelegate.html.name: -bluedotServiceDidReceiveError:
Protocols/BDPBluedotServiceDelegate.html.abstract: This method is called if Bluedot Error encouters an error.

Protocols/BDPBluedotServiceDelegate.html.name: -accuracyAuthorizationDidChangeFromPreviousAuthorization:toNewAuthorization:
Protocols/BDPBluedotServiceDelegate.html.abstract: Available from iOS 14. This method can be implemented to keep track of changes in Location Manager’s CLAccuracyAuthorization .

Protocols/BDPBluedotServiceDelegate.html.name: BDPBluedotServiceDelegate
Protocols/BDPBluedotServiceDelegate.html.abstract: Defines the call-backs which Point SDK makes to inform the Application of Bluedot service level events.

Protocols/BDPGeoTriggeringEventDelegate..name: BDPGeoTriggeringEventDelegate
Protocols/BDPGeoTriggeringEventDelegate..abstract: Defines the call-backs which Point SDK makes to inform the Application of Geotriggering events.

Protocols/BDPGeometry.html.name: BDPGeometry
Protocols/BDPGeometry.html.abstract: Geometrical methods required for implementation of a concrete geometry class.

Protocols/BDPJSONSerializable.html.name: BDPJSONSerializable
Protocols/BDPJSONSerializable.html.abstract: Any object can be Json-serialized to a Dictionary of Foundation objects

Protocols/BDPJSONDeserializable.html.name: BDPJSONDeserializable
Protocols/BDPJSONDeserializable.html.abstract: Any object can be Json-deserialized and instantiated from a Json Dictionary

Protocols/BDPNamedDescribed.html.name: BDPNamedDescribed
Protocols/BDPNamedDescribed.html.abstract: Any object having a human-readable name and description, typically for display in a User Interface.

Protocols/BDPTempoTrackingDelegate.html.name: BDPTempoTrackingDelegate
Protocols/BDPTempoTrackingDelegate.html.abstract: Defines the call-backs which Point SDK makes to inform the Application of Tempo events.

Protocols/BDPValidatable.html.name: BDPValidatable
Protocols/BDPValidatable.html.abstract: Any object whose state can be validated for correctness.

Protocols/JsonString.html.name: JsonString
Protocols/JsonString.html.abstract: Protocol to convert an object to a Json string

Protocols/Event.html.name: Event
Protocols/Event.html.abstract: An event in Bluedot SDK. Could be a GeoTriggerEvent (e.g. FenceEntered, FenceExited), a TempoEvent or a LifecycleEvent

Enums/TempoUpdateETADirection.html#/c:@M.name: lessThan
Enums/TempoUpdateETADirection.html#/c:@M.abstract: When the ETA is less than the eta value

Enums/TempoUpdateETADirection.html#/c:@M.name: greaterThan
Enums/TempoUpdateETADirection.html#/c:@M.abstract: When the ETA is greater than the eta value

Enums/NotificationType.html#/c:@M@BDPoin.name: entry
Enums/NotificationType.html#/c:@M@BDPoin.abstract: GeoTrigger entry when device enters a zone

Enums/NotificationType.html#/c:@M@BDPoin.name: exit
Enums/NotificationType.html#/c:@M@BDPoin.abstract: GeoTrigger exit when device exits a zone

Enums/TriggerEngine.html#/c:@M@BDPointSD.name: bd
Enums/TriggerEngine.html#/c:@M@BDPointSD.abstract: bd is the default engine using Bluedot’s GeoFencing solution

Enums/TriggerEngine.html#/c:@M@BDPointSD.name: native
Enums/TriggerEngine.html#/c:@M@BDPointSD.abstract: native engine utilizes iOS native GeoFencing when the app is not running.

Enums/BDGeoTriggeringError.html#/c:@E@BD.name: BDGeoTriggeringErrorCannotStartWhileAlreadyInProgress
Enums/BDGeoTriggeringError.html#/c:@E@BD.abstract: Couldn’t start Geo-triggering service when Geo-triggering already in progress

Enums/BDGeoTriggeringError.html#/c:@E@BD.name: BDGeoTriggeringErrorCannotStopWhileNotInProgress
Enums/BDGeoTriggeringError.html#/c:@E@BD.abstract: Trying to stop Geo-Triggering when it is not in progress

Enums/BDGeoTriggeringError.html#/c:@E@BD.name: BDGeoTriggeringErrorInsufficientLocationPermission
Enums/BDGeoTriggeringError.html#/c:@E@BD.abstract: Couldn’t start Geo-triggering service due to insufficient Location Permision. Always or When in use permission is required

Enums/BDGeoTriggeringError.html#/c:@E@BD.name: BDGeoTriggeringErrorCannotStartWhileApplicationInBackground
Enums/BDGeoTriggeringError.html#/c:@E@BD.abstract: Couldn’t start Geo-triggering service when application is in the background

Enums/BDGeoTriggeringError.html#/c:@E@BD.name: BDGeoTriggeringErrorZoneDownloadFailed
Enums/BDGeoTriggeringError.html#/c:@E@BD.abstract: Fail to download zone info from Canvas

Enums/BDGeoTriggeringError.html#/c:@E@BD.name: BDGeoTriggeringInsufficientNotificationPermission
Enums/BDGeoTriggeringError.html#/c:@E@BD.abstract: Couldn’t start Geo-Trigggering with restart notification service, due to insufficient notifications permission

Enums/BDTempoError.html#/c:@E@BDTempoErr.name: BDTempoErrorCannotStartWhileAlreadyInProgress
Enums/BDTempoError.html#/c:@E@BDTempoErr.abstract: Tempo Tracking cannot start while already in progress

Enums/BDTempoError.html#/c:@E@BDTempoErr.name: BDTempoErrorCannotStopWhileNotInProgress
Enums/BDTempoError.html#/c:@E@BDTempoErr.abstract: Tempo Tracking cannot stop while Tempo is not in progress

Enums/BDTempoError.html#/c:@E@BDTempoErr.name: BDTempoErrorInsufficientLocationPermission
Enums/BDTempoError.html#/c:@E@BDTempoErr.abstract: Couldn’t start Tempo due to insufficient Location Permision. Always permission is required

Enums/BDTempoError.html#/c:@E@BDTempoErr.name: BDTempoErrorCannotStartWhileApplicationInBackground
Enums/BDTempoError.html#/c:@E@BDTempoErr.abstract: Couldn’t start Tempo when application is in the background

Enums/BDTempoError.html#/c:@E@BDTempoErr.name: BDTempoErrorSDKHasBeenReset
Enums/BDTempoError.html#/c:@E@BDTempoErr.abstract: Tempo Tracking stopped due to SDK has been reset

Enums/BDTempoError.html#/c:@E@BDTempoErr.name: BDTempoErrorUnexpectedError
Enums/BDTempoError.html#/c:@E@BDTempoErr.abstract: Tempo Tracking stopped due to an unexpected error

Enums/BDTempoError.html#/c:@E@BDTempoErr.name: BDTempoErrorTempoNotEnabled
Enums/BDTempoError.html#/c:@E@BDTempoErr.abstract: Tempo is not enabled. Contact Bluedot Support team to have it enabled.

Enums/TriggerEngine.html.name: TriggerEngine
Enums/TriggerEngine.html.abstract: Trigger Engine of the PointSDK when this trigger happens.

Constants.html#/c:BDLocationManager+BDPo.name: BDServiceErrorDomain
Constants.html#/c:BDLocationManager+BDPo.abstract: Error Domain name for Bluedot Service Error

Classes/AppState.html#/c:@M@BDPointSDK@o.name: batteryLevel
Classes/AppState.html#/c:@M@BDPointSDK@o.abstract: Current Battery level of the device. 0 .. 1.0. -1.0 if UIDeviceBatteryStateUnknown

Classes/AppState.html#/c:@M@BDPointSDK@o.name: blueBarEnabled
Classes/AppState.html#/c:@M@BDPointSDK@o.abstract: Whether Bluebar mode (aka Background Location Access) is enabled or not.

Classes/AppState.html#/c:@M@BDPointSDK@o.name: lastRuleDownload
Classes/AppState.html#/c:@M@BDPointSDK@o.abstract: When rules were last downloaded from Canvas

Classes/AppState.html#/c:@M@BDPointSDK@o.name: locationPermission
Classes/AppState.html#/c:@M@BDPointSDK@o.abstract: Location permission status. Available values: [always, while_using, denied, not_determined, restricted, unknown]

Classes/AppState.html#/c:@M@BDPointSDK@o.name: notificationPermission
Classes/AppState.html#/c:@M@BDPointSDK@o.abstract: Notification permission status. Available values: [authorized, provisional, ephemeral, not_determined, denied, unknown]

Classes/AppInfo.html#/c:@M@BDPointSDK@ob.name: sdkVersion
Classes/AppInfo.html#/c:@M@BDPointSDK@ob.abstract: The PointSDK version running with the application

Classes/AppInfo.html#/c:@M@BDPointSDK@ob.name: customEventMetaData
Classes/AppInfo.html#/c:@M@BDPointSDK@ob.abstract: PointSDK customEventMetaData at the time trigger event is sent

Classes/Destination.html#/c:@M@BDPointSD.name: destinationId
Classes/Destination.html#/c:@M@BDPointSD.abstract: The destination id is used to identify the destination. This is used to trigger Tempo, send Wave events and link Zones to a destination.

Classes/Destination.html#/c:@M@BDPointSD.name: location
Classes/Destination.html#/c:@M@BDPointSD.abstract: A BDPoint that stores spatial geographic information (i.e longitude, latitude) of the destination

Classes/TempoTrackingUpdate.html#/c:@M@B.name: triggerChainId
Classes/TempoTrackingUpdate.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: The unique UDID of the trigger chain

Classes/TempoTrackingUpdate.html#/c:@M@B.name: eta
Classes/TempoTrackingUpdate.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: The ETA from the destination, in minutes

Classes/TempoTrackingUpdate.html#/c:@M@B.name: etaDirection
Classes/TempoTrackingUpdate.html#/c:@M@B.abstract: The ETA direction, either lessThan or greaterThan

Classes/FenceExited.html#/c:@M@BDPointSD.name: eventTime
Classes/FenceExited.html#/c:@M@BDPointSD.abstract: Date Time when the trigger event happened

Classes/FenceExited.html#/c:@M@BDPointSD.name: fenceName
Classes/FenceExited.html#/c:@M@BDPointSD.abstract: Name of the last crossed fence leading up to the trigger event

Classes/FenceExited.html#/c:@M@BDPointSD.name: fenceId
Classes/FenceExited.html#/c:@M@BDPointSD.abstract: Unique Id of the last crossed fence leading up to the trigger event

Classes/FenceExited.html#/c:@M@BDPointSD.name: locations
Classes/FenceExited.html#/c:@M@BDPointSD.abstract: The Location Update leading to the event

Classes/FenceExited.html#/c:@M@BDPointSD.name: triggerEngine
Classes/FenceExited.html#/c:@M@BDPointSD.abstract: Trigger Engine of the PointSDK when this trigger happens.

Classes/FenceExited.html#/c:@M@BDPointSD.name: distance
Classes/FenceExited.html#/c:@M@BDPointSD.abstract: Distance from the last Location causing the exit event to the Zone, in meters.

Classes/FenceExited.html#/c:@M@BDPointSD.name: distanceRequired
Classes/FenceExited.html#/c:@M@BDPointSD.abstract: Distance required from the zone to trigger an exit event, in meters.

Classes/FenceExited.html#/c:@M@BDPointSD.name: dwellTime
Classes/FenceExited.html#/c:@M@BDPointSD.abstract: Dwell time from entry to exit, in milliseconds

Classes/FenceExited.html#/c:@M@BDPointSD.name: timeZoneIdentifier
Classes/FenceExited.html#/c:@M@BDPointSD.abstract: Local Timezone of the device when the FenceEntered event happens

Classes/FenceEntered.html#/c:@M@BDPointS.name: eventTime
Classes/FenceEntered.html#/c:@M@BDPointS.abstract: Date Time when the trigger event happened

Classes/FenceEntered.html#/c:@M@BDPointS.name: fenceName
Classes/FenceEntered.html#/c:@M@BDPointS.abstract: Name of the last crossed fence leading up to the trigger event

Classes/FenceEntered.html#/c:@M@BDPointS.name: fenceId
Classes/FenceEntered.html#/c:@M@BDPointS.abstract: Unique Id of the last crossed fence leading up to the trigger event

Classes/FenceEntered.html#/c:@M@BDPointS.name: locations
Classes/FenceEntered.html#/c:@M@BDPointS.abstract: The Location Update leading to the event

Classes/FenceEntered.html#/c:@M@BDPointS.name: crossedFences
Classes/FenceEntered.html#/c:@M@BDPointS.abstract: List of crossed fences leading to this Fence Entered event

Classes/FenceEntered.html#/c:@M@BDPointS.name: triggerEngine
Classes/FenceEntered.html#/c:@M@BDPointS.abstract: Trigger Engine of the PointSDK when this trigger happens.

Classes/FenceEntered.html#/c:@M@BDPointS.name: timeZoneIdentifier
Classes/FenceEntered.html#/c:@M@BDPointS.abstract: Local Timezone of the device when the FenceEntered event happens

Classes/GeoTriggerEvent.html#/c:@M@BDPoi.name: installRef
Classes/GeoTriggerEvent.html#/c:@M@BDPoi.abstract: The installation reference of this Point SDK enabled App. Same as BDLocationManager/installRef

Classes/GeoTriggerEvent.html#/c:@M@BDPoi.name: triggerChainId
Classes/GeoTriggerEvent.html#/c:@M@BDPoi.abstract: The unique ID of the trigger chain.

Classes/GeoTriggerEvent.html#/c:@M@BDPoi.name: notificationType
Classes/GeoTriggerEvent.html#/c:@M@BDPoi.abstract: Notification Type of this event. For GeoTriggerEvent events, can be either entry or exit

Classes/GeoTriggerEvent.html#/c:@M@BDPoi.name: zoneInfo
Classes/GeoTriggerEvent.html#/c:@M@BDPoi.abstract: Details of the zone triggering the event

Classes/GeoTriggerEvent.html#/c:@M@BDPoi.name: appInfo
Classes/GeoTriggerEvent.html#/c:@M@BDPoi.abstract: Application-related detail. Note that the PointSDK’s customEventMetaData is included in this appInfo

Classes/GeoTriggerEvent.html#/c:@M@BDPoi.name: triggerEvents
Classes/GeoTriggerEvent.html#/c:@M@BDPoi.abstract: A list of trigger events included in this GeoTriggerEvent.

Classes/GeoTriggerEvent.html#/c:@M@BDPoi.name: entryEvent
Classes/GeoTriggerEvent.html#/c:@M@BDPoi.abstract: A FenceEntered event causing the zone entry trigger, same as the first event in triggerEvents.

Classes/GeoTriggerEvent.html#/c:@M@BDPoi.name: exitEvent
Classes/GeoTriggerEvent.html#/c:@M@BDPoi.abstract: A FenceExited event causing the zone exit trigger, same as the last event in triggerEvents.

Classes/BDZoneInfo.html#/c:objc(cs)BDZon.name: name
Classes/BDZoneInfo.html#/c:objc(cs)BDZon.abstract: The name of this Zone that was entered into Canvas

Classes/BDZoneInfo.html#/c:objc(cs)BDZon.name: description
Classes/BDZoneInfo.html#/c:objc(cs)BDZon.abstract: The description of this Zone that was entered into Canvas

Classes/BDZoneInfo.html#/c:objc(cs)BDZon.name: fences
Classes/BDZoneInfo.html#/c:objc(cs)BDZon.abstract: The set of BDFenceInfo fences included in this Zone.

Classes/BDZoneInfo.html#/c:objc(cs)BDZon.name: checkOut
Classes/BDZoneInfo.html#/c:objc(cs)BDZon.abstract: Whether CheckOuts should be generated for any CheckIns to this Zone.

Classes/BDZoneInfo.html#/c:objc(cs)BDZon.name: destination
Classes/BDZoneInfo.html#/c:objc(cs)BDZon.abstract: The Destination (aka Store) that this zone is linked with.

Classes/BDPolygonal.html#/c:objc(cs)BDPo.name: -vertexCount
Classes/BDPolygonal.html#/c:objc(cs)BDPo.abstract: @returns The number of vertices (BDPoint “point"s) that define this polygonal geometry.

Classes/BDPolygonal.html#/c:objc(cs)BDPo.name: -addVertex:
Classes/BDPolygonal.html#/c:objc(cs)BDPo.abstract: Convenience method to add a new vertex to this BDPolygons vertices array.

Classes/BDPolygonal.html#/c:objc(cs)BDPo.name: vertices
Classes/BDPolygonal.html#/c:objc(cs)BDPo.abstract: An ordered series of BDPoint “point” vertices which, when joined by straight-line segments, describe this polygonal geometry.

Classes/BDPolygonal.html#/c:objc(cs)BDPo.name: -isClosed
Classes/BDPolygonal.html#/c:objc(cs)BDPo.abstract: @returns YES if this geometry is closed and has an area. NO if the geometry is open-ended and has no area.

Classes/BDPolygon.html#/c:objc(cs)BDPoly.name: +polygonWithVertices:copy:
Classes/BDPolygon.html#/c:objc(cs)BDPoly.abstract: Convenience method to create a BDPolygon with an array of BDPoint vertices.

Classes/BDPolygon.html#/c:objc(cs)BDPoly.name: +polygonWithLatLongCoordinates:
Classes/BDPolygon.html#/c:objc(cs)BDPoly.abstract: Convenience method to construct an ad-hoc polygon using variable length lat/long variable arguments.

Classes/BDPoint.html#/c:objc(cs)BDPoint(.name: +pointWithLongitude:latitude:
Classes/BDPoint.html#/c:objc(cs)BDPoint(.abstract: Convenience constructor to create a BDPoint “point” with a longitude and latitude, in degrees.

Classes/BDPoint.html#/c:objc(cs)BDPoint(.name: -initWithLongitude:latitude:
Classes/BDPoint.html#/c:objc(cs)BDPoint(.abstract: Initializes a point with values for for longitude and latitude, in degrees.

Classes/BDPoint.html#/c:objc(cs)BDPoint(.name: -initWithCoordinate:
Classes/BDPoint.html#/c:objc(cs)BDPoint(.abstract: Initializes a point with longitude and latitude in degrees.

Classes/BDPoint.html#/c:objc(cs)BDPoint(.name: -latitudeString
Classes/BDPoint.html#/c:objc(cs)BDPoint(.abstract: @returns a string representation of this points’ degrees latitude, e.g. “12.34°”

Classes/BDPoint.html#/c:objc(cs)BDPoint(.name: -longitudeString
Classes/BDPoint.html#/c:objc(cs)BDPoint(.abstract: @returns a string representation of this points’ degrees longitude, e.g. “359.99°”

Classes/BDPoint.html#/c:objc(cs)BDPoint(.name: longitude
Classes/BDPoint.html#/c:objc(cs)BDPoint(.abstract: The longitudinal component of this points location, in the range -180 < 0 <= 180 degrees.

Classes/BDPoint.html#/c:objc(cs)BDPoint(.name: latitude
Classes/BDPoint.html#/c:objc(cs)BDPoint(.abstract: The latitudinal component of this points location, in the range -90 < 0 <= 90 degrees.

Classes/BDPoint.html#/c:objc(cs)BDPoint(.name: coordinate
Classes/BDPoint.html#/c:objc(cs)BDPoint(.abstract: This points location, expressed as a BDLocationCoordinate2D structure.

Classes/BDPoint.html#/c:objc(cs)BDPoint(.name: -isOrigin
Classes/BDPoint.html#/c:objc(cs)BDPoint(.abstract: @returns YES if the point is at 0 degrees latitude and longitude. NO otherwise.

Classes/BDLocationInfo.html#/c:objc(cs)B.name: timestamp
Classes/BDLocationInfo.html#/c:objc(cs)B.abstract: The time at which this location was determined.

Classes/BDLocationInfo.html#/c:objc(cs)B.name: latitude
Classes/BDLocationInfo.html#/c:objc(cs)B.abstract: The latitude at which this location was determined.

Classes/BDLocationInfo.html#/c:objc(cs)B.name: longitude
Classes/BDLocationInfo.html#/c:objc(cs)B.abstract: The longitude at which this location was determined.

Classes/BDLocationInfo.html#/c:objc(cs)B.name: bearing
Classes/BDLocationInfo.html#/c:objc(cs)B.abstract: The bearing of the device at the latitude and longitude of the location.

Classes/BDLocationInfo.html#/c:objc(cs)B.name: speed
Classes/BDLocationInfo.html#/c:objc(cs)B.abstract: The speed of the device at the latitude and longitude of the location.

Classes/BDLocation.html#/c:objc(cs)BDLoc.name: -initWithCLLocation:
Classes/BDLocation.html#/c:objc(cs)BDLoc.abstract: Initialisation methods for to creation a location.

Classes/BDLocation.html#/c:objc(cs)BDLoc.name: -initWithLatitude:longitude:altitude:accuracy:altitudeAccuracy:speed:bearing:
Classes/BDLocation.html#/c:objc(cs)BDLoc.abstract: Initialisation methods for to creation a location.

Classes/BDLocation.html#/c:objc(cs)BDLoc.name: accuracy
Classes/BDLocation.html#/c:objc(cs)BDLoc.abstract: The accuracy, in metres, to which this location is known. Sometimes referred to as the ‘horizontal accuracy’ or just ‘error’.

Classes/BDLocation.html#/c:objc(cs)BDLoc.name: altitudeAccuracy
Classes/BDLocation.html#/c:objc(cs)BDLoc.abstract: The altitude accuracy, in metres, to which this location is known. Sometimes referred to as the ‘vertical accuracy’ or just ‘error’.

Classes/BDLocation.html#/c:objc(cs)BDLoc.name: point
Classes/BDLocation.html#/c:objc(cs)BDLoc.abstract: The geographic location of this location, over the surface of the earth, independent of it’s altitude.

Classes/BDLocation.html#/c:objc(cs)BDLoc.name: altitude
Classes/BDLocation.html#/c:objc(cs)BDLoc.abstract: The altitude of this geographic location in metres.

Classes/BDLocation.html#/c:objc(cs)BDLoc.name: speed
Classes/BDLocation.html#/c:objc(cs)BDLoc.abstract: The speed of the device at the point of the location.

Classes/BDLocation.html#/c:objc(cs)BDLoc.name: bearing
Classes/BDLocation.html#/c:objc(cs)BDLoc.abstract: The bearing of the device at the point of the location.

Classes/BDLocation.html#/c:objc(cs)BDLoc.name: provider
Classes/BDLocation.html#/c:objc(cs)BDLoc.abstract: The location method provider of the device at the point of the location

Classes/BDLineString.html#/c:objc(cs)BDL.name: +lineStringWithVertices:copy:
Classes/BDLineString.html#/c:objc(cs)BDL.abstract: Convenience init method with a list of BDPoint vertices

Classes/BDLineString.html#/c:objc(cs)BDL.name: +lineWithStart:end:
Classes/BDLineString.html#/c:objc(cs)BDL.abstract: Convenience class method to init a BDLineString with a start BDPoint and an end BDPoint

Classes/BDLineString.html#/c:objc(cs)BDL.name: -initWithVertices:copy:
Classes/BDLineString.html#/c:objc(cs)BDL.abstract: Convenience init method with a list of BDPoint vertices

Classes/BDLineString.html#/c:objc(cs)BDL.name: -initWithStart:end:
Classes/BDLineString.html#/c:objc(cs)BDL.abstract: Convenience method to init a BDLineString with a start BDPoint and an end BDPoint

Classes/BDLineString.html#/c:objc(cs)BDL.name: start
Classes/BDLineString.html#/c:objc(cs)BDL.abstract: Quick access to the start BDPoint of the LineString

Classes/BDLineString.html#/c:objc(cs)BDL.name: end

Classes/BDCircle.html#/c:objc(cs)BDCircl.abstract: Compare the current circle with the passing in circle.

Classes/BDBoundingBox.html#/c:objc(cs)BD.abstract: Initializes a BDBoundingBox with individual values for the four bounding edges, in degrees.

Classes/BDBoundingBox.html#/c:objc(cs)BD.abstract: Initializes a BDBoundingBox with BDPoint values for two of the bounding corners.

Classes/BDBoundingBox.html#/c:objc(cs)BD.abstract: Initializes a BDBoundingBox using a MapKit coordinate region.

Classes/BDBoundingBox.html#/c:objc(cs)BD.name: -coordinateRegion
Classes/BDBoundingBox.html#/c:objc(cs)BD.abstract: @returns the equivalent MapKit coordinate region representation of this rectangular region.

Classes/BDBoundingBox.html#/c:objc(cs)BD.name: -west
Classes/BDBoundingBox.html#/c:objc(cs)BD.abstract: @returns the longitudinal component of the South-West corner point of this rectangular region

Classes/BDBoundingBox.html#/c:objc(cs)BD.name: -north
Classes/BDBoundingBox.html#/c:objc(cs)BD.abstract: Returns the latitudinal component of the North-East corner point of this rectangular region

Classes/BDBoundingBox.html#/c:objc(cs)BD.name: -east
Classes/BDBoundingBox.html#/c:objc(cs)BD.abstract: @returns the longitudinal component of the North-East corner point of this rectangular region

Classes/BDBoundingBox.html#/c:objc(cs)BD.name: -setSouth:
Classes/BDBoundingBox.html#/c:objc(cs)BD.abstract: Sets the latitudinal component of the South-West corner point of this rectangular region

Classes/BDBoundingBox.html#/c:objc(cs)BD.name: -south
Classes/BDBoundingBox.html#/c:objc(cs)BD.abstract: @returns the latitudinal component of the South-West corner point of this rectangular region

Classes/BDBoundingBox.html#/c:objc(cs)BD.name: -longitudeSpan
Classes/BDBoundingBox.html#/c:objc(cs)BD.abstract: @returns the absolute difference between the East and West longitudes, in degrees.

Classes/BDBoundingBox.html#/c:objc(cs)BD.name: -latitudeSpan
Classes/BDBoundingBox.html#/c:objc(cs)BD.abstract: @returns the absolute difference between the North and South latitudes, in degrees.

Classes/BDBoundingBox.html#/c:objc(cs)BD.name: northEast
Classes/BDBoundingBox.html#/c:objc(cs)BD.abstract: The North-East corner of this rectangular region

Classes/BDBoundingBox.html#/c:objc(cs)BD.name: southWest
Classes/BDBoundingBox.html#/c:objc(cs)BD.abstract: The South-West corner of this rectangular region

Classes/BDBoundingBox.html#/c:objc(cs)BD.name: -vertices
Classes/BDBoundingBox.html#/c:objc(cs)BD.abstract: @returns An array of the corner BDPoint “points” of this BDBoundingBox, ordered: North, East, South, West.

Classes/BDLocationManager.html.name: BDLocationManager
Classes/BDLocationManager.html.abstract: Entry-point for your Application’s interaction with Point SDK.

Classes/BDBoundingBox.html.name: BDBoundingBox
Classes/BDBoundingBox.html.abstract: A rectangular coordinate region on the Earth’s surface, defined by two latitude / longitude corner BDPoint “points”.

Classes/BDCircle.html.name: BDCircle
Classes/BDCircle.html.abstract: A circular region on the Earth’s surface, defined by a center BDPoint “point” and a radius, in meters.

Classes/BDFenceInfo.html.name: BDFenceInfo
Classes/BDFenceInfo.html.abstract: Information about a geofence, as defined in Canvas.

Classes/BDLineString.html.name: BDLineString
Classes/BDLineString.html.abstract: Open-ended geometry consisting of two or more BDPoint “points” connected by straight-line segments.

Classes/BDLocation.html.name: BDLocation
Classes/BDLocation.html.abstract: Represents a recorded, geographic location; combining a geographic BDPointSDK “point” with an altitude, as well as a known

Classes/BDPoint.html.name: BDPoint
Classes/BDPoint.html.abstract: A geographic point expressed in latitude and longitude coordinates.

Classes/BDPointSessionException.html.name: BDPointSessionException
Classes/BDPointSessionException.html.abstract: Thrown when the Point SDK session life-cycle or initialization state has been violated.

Classes/BDPolygon.html.name: BDPolygon
Classes/BDPolygon.html.abstract: Arbitrary region on the Earth’s surface, comprised of two or more BDPoint “points” connected by straight-line segments.

Classes/BDPolygonal.html.name: BDPolygonal
Classes/BDPolygonal.html.abstract: Base-class for BDGeometry “geometries” defined by an ordered series of BDPoint “points”.

Classes/BDZoneInfo.html.name: BDZoneInfo
Classes/BDZoneInfo.html.abstract: Contains information about a Zone, including the set of BDFenceInfo “fences” that comprise it.

Classes/GeoTriggerEvent.html.name: GeoTriggerEvent
Classes/GeoTriggerEvent.html.abstract: An event triggered by GeoTriggering service when a trigger (zone entry or exit) happens.

Classes/CrossedFence.html.name: CrossedFence
Classes/CrossedFence.html.abstract: A CrossedFence records details when a Fence is crossed.

Classes/FenceEntered.html.name: FenceEntered
Classes/FenceEntered.html.abstract: A FenceEntered event is triggered when Zone entry conditions are met and an Entry trigger is to be registered in Canvas

Classes/FenceExited.html.name: FenceExited
Classes/FenceExited.html.abstract: A FenceExited event is triggered when the device leaves a zone and an Exit trigger is to be registered in Canvas

Classes/TempoTrackingUpdate.html.name: TempoTrackingUpdate
Classes/TempoTrackingUpdate.html.abstract: Detail of the TempoUpdate event being reported to main application via callback BDPTempoTrackingDelegate/tempoTrackingDidUpdate(_:)

Classes/Destination.html.name: Destination
Classes/Destination.html.abstract: A Destination is a physical location your customers arrive at to collect their mobile order – this is usually your store or restaurant. Also known as Stores within Canvas

Classes/AppState.html.name: AppState
Classes/AppState.html.abstract: Details about current state of the application

Classes/ZoneInfo.html.name: ZoneInfo
Classes/ZoneInfo.html.abstract: Details of a Zone. See its usage in GeoTriggerEvent.

Type%20Definitions.html.name: Type Definitions
Type%20Definitions.html.abstract: The following type definitions are available globally.
